Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sensitivity \Sen`si*tiv"i*ty\, n. The quality or state of being sensitive; -- used chiefly in science and the arts; as, the sensitivity of iodized silver. [1913 Webster]
Sensitivity and emotivity have also been used as the scientific term for the capacity of feeling. --Hickok. [1913 Webster]

sensitivity n 1: (physiology) responsiveness to external stimuli; "sensitivity to pain" [syn: {sensitiveness}, {sensibility}] 2: the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences; "a galvanometer of extreme sensitivity" 3: sensitivity to emotional feelings (of self and others) [syn: {sensitiveness}] 4: susceptibility to a pathogen [syn: {predisposition}] 5: the ability to respond to affective changes in your interpersonal environment [syn: {sensitiveness}] [ant: {insensitivity}, {insensitivity}]
